instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Water Damaged Green Light Doesn't Turn Orange
threads.message: I've got an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) that had some liquid damage around the top edge of the board. After ultrasonic cleaning and replacing the <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> PPBUS was restored (12.57V). With several known good 85W real MagSafe Adapters and DC-In boards the board only gets a green light that does not change over to orange. I have made sure that SMCRESET is not low or cycling. I have also made sure that the resistance between 17/18 and 27/28 of ISL is in spec. I do no have <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> and the TPS and <CHIP>U8080</CHIP> were burned and were replaced as well with all associated MOSFETs. I have never seen the green light come on but not reset with an SMC reset or change to orange. Could this be a bad SMC?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Water Damaged Green Light Doesn't Turn Orange
threads.message: <SIGNAL>G2_EN</SIGNAL> present? Voltage on center pin of magsafe with adapter connected?
